title: Kaliandra
author: Kaliandra
content: I have 2 motorbikes at home, but what I always use is only 1 motorbike, and 1 motorbike is rarely used, and indeed the motorbike is also old, and if it is sold it won't be too expensive, and I decided to sell the motorbike, because in my opinion the price of the motorbike will definitely fall over time,(affected by inflation). and the money from the sale of the motorbike I will use to buy bitcoin. because in my opinion the price of bitcoin in the future will definitely rise. and also currently the market is bear, so this is a good opportunity to buy bitcoins. and I want to ask everyone, the decision I made, namely selling the motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, is it wrong or not?I'm ready to be corrected because I have no experience in bitcoin and crypto.

comments.author: Solokan
comments.body: I think if you want to sell your motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, in my opinion that's the right decision, because now is the time to buy bitcoin, because the market is bearish, of course if you buy now it will definitely have good potential for the future. but still you also have to think about the risk of investing in bitcoin, because investing is a risk of profit and loss. but if you don't sell your motorbike either I don't think there will be a problem because an old motorbike will usually have the potential to become an antique in the future. And the price will be expensive, so in this case it depends on your decision.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Invest in Bitcoin is good if you don't make loans for investment.You had a good plan to keep one motorbike to use and sell the motorbike you don't use to buy Bitcoin. You did not make any loan, you did not sell anything you are using and needing for your life to invest in Bitcoin.It is a good and so safe plan.Before buying Bitcoin, you must plan to store it in your wallet, not on exchange, not in custodial wallets.Hardware wallets are best but they are not best for you because you won't get much money from a motorbike sale so it is unrealistic to buy a hardware wallet at this moment.Electrum wallet is free to use and it is good.[GUIDE] How to Safely Download and Verify Electrum [Guide]Download it for iOS, Windows, Android and Portable versions too: https://electrum.org/#downloadIt has multisig wallets and cold storagehttps://electrum.readthedocs.io/en/latest/multisig.htmlhttps://electrum.readthedocs.io/en/latest/coldstorage.html

comments.author: posi
comments.body: Why not? You can sell that car because you also don't use it, and if left for a long time, its value will also decrease. But not caused by inflation, don't blame it for inflation, your property is old, second-hand. It's funny when people always blame inflation or fiat when the value of their assets falls. You can't expect motorbikes that have been used for many years to sell for like new, LOL.To get a return on your investment in bitcoin you need a plan and a goal, and a strategy, bitcoin is not a get-rich-quick asset.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: You have made the right decision to sell your spare and old bike. OP your bike's value will not increase over time but it will lost its value so buy some bitcoins with it. Bitcoin price will definitely go up if not today tomorrow will but if you don't buy bitcoin in the current bearish market you may miss the chance to buy at cheaper price.You have taken the right decision in my opinion and now don't take time to implement your plan. Sell the bike and buy bitcoin and store them on a bitcoin wallet not in exchange.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Good idea as you are grabbing the opportunity instead of savings. Saving money is the loss of money as you said the bike was not in use or is not in use so your decision is good. As far i know you won't regret this. BTC is on its Knees or you can say in the depth of the bottom so if a wave rise from where it can be bigger than the Eiffel tower haha just an idea.

comments.author: worle1bm
comments.body: See if the bike was not in your use and you have decided to invest the surplus money into bitcoin then definitely you have made the right choice.The rule says you should invest after analysing all the risk and don't invest what you can't afford to loose but the money you got by selling the bike was surplus so you are good for it.But if you have long term approach in mind then it's best because you will get return and hold on to your nerves in next dip then only you will get profits.But you have made a good decision man.

comments.author: Minecache
comments.body: There is nothing wrong with selling unnecessary assets to invest in bitcoin.The more important thing you need to care about is the knowledge to invest, I think you need to have a basic understanding of bitcoin such as how to buy, sell, and store…to get started. Investing in bitcoin is not in a hurry because just one small mistake can lose all the money you have which cannot be reverted. My sincere advice, since you are inexperienced in the market, after selling your motorbikes, you should only invest in bitcoin. Refrain from being curious or greedy to invest in altcoins, it will make you lose heavily.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: Kaliandra on January 07, 2023, 12:08:03 PMand I want to ask everyone, the decision I made, namely selling the motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, is it wrong or not?Well, you already answered it on your post already and if likely you're determine to sell it for Bitcoin, have second thoughts before you do so. It's not like easy as that for an speculation, price valuation may take longer than expected and I hope you're prepared if it declines even more in this stage.I'm not discouraging you not to but this scenario is likely to happen and it may disrupt your mind if you want to sell it for a loss or hold it until you're in profit. It will be wrong if you buy then sold it for a huge loss and it will be the right decision if you hold onto it the longer.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: Kaliandra on January 07, 2023, 12:08:03 PMI have 2 motorbikes at home, but what I always use is only 1 motorbike, and 1 motorbike is rarely used, and indeed the motorbike is also old, and if it is sold it won't be too expensive, and I decided to sell the motorbike, because in my opinion the price of the motorbike will definitely fall over time,(affected by inflation). and the money from the sale of the motorbike I will use to buy bitcoin. because in my opinion the price of bitcoin in the future will definitely rise. and also currently the market is bear, so this is a good opportunity to buy bitcoins. and I want to ask everyone, the decision I made, namely selling the motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, is it wrong or not?I'm ready to be corrected because I have no experience in bitcoin and crypto.Selling something to buy something profitable is a good thing and you are doing 'investment' right in my opinion. Some people would sell what is necessary because of their impression towards something which is profitable, perhaps Bitcoin, which is not a good thing to do. Always check your necessities and only invest an amount you can afford losing, as being mentioned endlessly. Inspite of the potential for this technology, investors should still measure the risks involved and it won't be smart to loan (in some instances as mentioned by other users in this forum) just to invest. Any form of investment won't guarantee profit especially with this blockchain wherein the market prices are too volatile.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: Kaliandra on January 07, 2023, 12:08:03 PMI have 2 motorbikes at home, but what I always use is only 1 motorbike, and 1 motorbike is rarely used, and indeed the motorbike is also old, and if it is sold it won't be too expensive, and I decided to sell the motorbike, because in my opinion the price of the motorbike will definitely fall over time,(affected by inflation). and the money from the sale of the motorbike I will use to buy bitcoin. because in my opinion the price of bitcoin in the future will definitely rise. and also currently the market is bear, so this is a good opportunity to buy bitcoins. and I want to ask everyone, the decision I made, namely selling the motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, is it wrong or not?I'm ready to be corrected because I have no experience in bitcoin and crypto.Wrong decision or not, it's up to you.If I had a similar situation with 2 motorcycles, then I would get rid of one, and with the extra money I would buy btc. Actually, no, I would not buy 2nd motorcycles and immediately buy btc. Don't wait for approval or condemnation of your actions, but do what you think is right. Your life, your rules. But first, weigh all the possible risks and losses, and only then act.In general, it is a good idea to get rid of unnecessary things and buy bitcoin with this money and I support your decision.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: You made the right choice. Motorbikes value depreciate as time passes by while Bitcoin value is proven increasing over time no matter how hard it will dump from ATH. I believe no one has the right to correct you here for your decision since it’s your motorbike. Your other choices to do on the profit from bikes is to use it on business but investing on Bitcoin is the easiest way to earn profit long term.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: What you did can be a successful investment if you develop a plan for when you will sell the bitcoin that you bought, and what will you buy with it, meaning will you buy a new motor with it after three years, or will you reinvest?In general, if you develop a good plan, it may be a very successful investment.

comments.author: abel1337
comments.body: First, You need to understand what bitcoin and crypto is before you sell your motorbike. I'm sure that there will be a confusion or possible danger of losing your cryptocurrency after you sold your motorbike. Basic knowledge such as storing your crypto on wallets is needed to secure your investment. I know that your motorbike is valuable to you that's why you need to gain knowledge first before entering crypto because the last thing we want to happen is when your cryptocurrency has been stolen because of lack of security. But overall I think it's a good choice to sell unusable liabilities especially if it depreciates overtime. Putting it on bitcoin as an investment isn't a wrong decision, I believe it is how you manage it since most of us here in this forum has bitcoin and knows what could might happen in the future when the bull market arrives.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: If your motorcycle is gathering dust in your garage and no one can use it, such as relatives or your son, it might be time to sell it. If I were in your situation, I would repair and clean it first before selling it so that you can price it higher and ensure that there will be buyers. I own a motorcycle too, but I won't be selling it even if I buy a new one, as it has sentimental value to me. After selling it, you can invest it in bitcoin because there is a high chance of profit but also some risk.Â  Just be careful and make sure your bitcoin is secure, like storing it in your own wallet and not in an exchange.

comments.author: Inwestour
comments.body: Quote from: Kaliandra on January 07, 2023, 12:08:03 PMI have 2 motorbikes at home, but what I always use is only 1 motorbike, and 1 motorbike is rarely used, and indeed the motorbike is also old, and if it is sold it won't be too expensive, and I decided to sell the motorbike, because in my opinion the price of the motorbike will definitely fall over time,(affected by inflation). and the money from the sale of the motorbike I will use to buy bitcoin. because in my opinion the price of bitcoin in the future will definitely rise. and also currently the market is bear, so this is a good opportunity to buy bitcoins. and I want to ask everyone, the decision I made, namely selling the motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, is it wrong or not?I'm ready to be corrected because I have no experience in bitcoin and crypto.Even if you have no experience in investing, then I would still not listen to the advice of other people, try to study all the available information and make a decision on your own. I don't know how much money to get for the bike, it should be a good amount. If I had to sell my car, I don't know if I would invest this money in bitcoin, maybe I would find another use for it.Yes, now is a very good time, the bear market has been going on for a very long time and this is considered by many to be the best time to buy bitcoin, I also support this. But it is very important that you study all the available information and make your own decision. This investment can bring profit in the future.

comments.author: reagansimms
comments.body: I really support your action. Instead of keeping a motorbike that is rarely used, the money can be used in a place that can provide more returns even if at certain times it is not as expected. Your belief that Bitcoin will rise in the future has prompted you to spend the money from selling motorbikes on Bitcoin, of course you will never regret the decision if at any time reality does not match expectations. But many cases have happened, after Bearish conditions will come Bullish. You need to be patient until the amount of money you invest in Bitcoin increases.

comments.author: SOKO-DEKE
comments.body: Quote from: Kaliandra on January 07, 2023, 12:08:03 PMI have 2 motorbikes at home, but what I always use is only 1 motorbike, and 1 motorbike is rarely used, and indeed the motorbike is also old, and if it is sold it won't be too expensive, and I decided to sell the motorbike, because in my opinion the price of the motorbike will definitely fall over time,(affected by inflation). and the money from the sale of the motorbike I will use to buy bitcoin. because in my opinion the price of bitcoin in the future will definitely rise. and also currently the market is bear, so this is a good opportunity to buy bitcoins. and I want to ask everyone, the decision I made, namely selling the motorbike and the money to buy bitcoin, is it wrong or not?I'm ready to be corrected because I have no experience in bitcoin and crypto.Based on your post's write-up, I don't think you made a make a wrong decision, by chosen to sell the motorbike you are no longer using in order to buy Bitcoin, which buying of Bitcoin you hope will bring you future financial success. That, in my opinion, is also a wise choice.Accumulating Bitcoin is a great idea but it is not advisable to sell your precious property to do so or take out a loan to do so because you believe you can profit from it in the future. Before selling your motorbike to buy Bitcoin, try to go thoroughly investigate the risks that the cryptocurrency market entails.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: This is a personal matter in fact, there are people who do not want to sell their physical possessions to buy bitcoins because they see it as a risk, they just buy bitcoins with more money than they need.On the other hand, there are people who sold everything they owned and bet on the rise of Bitcoin in the future.Personally, I see that this bet is profitable in the long run, because material things lose their value with time due to inflation, while Bitcoin maintains its value and increases with time.
